reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived at the hotel early hours of the 2nd august.. first impressions were good and from there the holiday just got better and better.
reviews.title: what a holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel was very clean and quite large, the two pools were clean and a desent size the main pool was always busy and very lively. the beach was large (quite narrow but long).
reviews.title: A great time at Tusan

reviews.text: there was always plenty to do, with the entertainment staff always organising games and activities throughout the day. including crazy darts, table tennis tournaments, shooting, boules, and pool games in the pool. the entertainment staff themselves were top class and always came over to talk and say hello, but were never pushy. just like to say thanks to Chris, Bobo, Bambi, Pikachu, Bibo, coco, and ozzy,, and of course the females betty and danielle.. the only one i would have any thing bad to say about was joker she was always moody and didnt smile or talk much.
reviews.title: What a holiday!!!

reviews.text: the other staff were also fab including tom the bar man,,, and yusef in the resaurant he would always have our beers ready on a table when he saw us walking to the resaurant even when the resaurant was full,,,,, And to all the other staff that really looked after us we couldnt have asked for any better,,, THANKYOU TO YOU ALL you made our holiday....................... and of course to stumpy who made us howl with laughter.. he he he
reviews.title: tusan, good but not the best

reviews.text: we are definately going back next year and cant wait, hopefully with a fab family we met there (HELLO GUYS IF YOU READ THIS)
reviews.title: Hotel from HELL!!!!! DO NOT under any circumstances stay there!!!!!!

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on this site regarding the Tusan Beach, we were a little aprehensive as to what to expect but can honestly say we had a lovely holiday.
reviews.title: Great hotel, would recommend.

reviews.text: The hotel itself, is in the most amazing location. It has a private beach, which was very clean and picturesque and there were pedaloes and canoes available free of charge ( if you stay all inclusive). The restaurant looked out over the Agean sea and you could hear the waves lapping on the beach whilst you ate, very 'Shirley Valentine'.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday, very friendly hotel, can't complain about anything

reviews.text: There are two swimming pools, both clean and well maintained with plenty of available sunbeds and umbrellas. There is entertainment by the pool but you are in no way forced to participate.
reviews.title: "Excellent but watch out for the mosquitos" ....

reviews.text: The interior of the hotel is quite impressive and facilities include a spa area where we had the most amazing turkish bath for 20 euros, a large lobby area with an internet cafe and seating area and a small shopping arcade which includes a hairdresser, gift shops, jewellers and a snack shop. Bedrooms are plain but clean and spacious with a small balcony.
reviews.title: Absolutley Fantastic

reviews.text: There is a large external bar and patio area with several smaller bars, serving unlimited drinks and snacks such as burgers and delicious open sandwiches.
reviews.title: Greeeaaatttt!!!!

reviews.text: NB we stayed in the off season (April) and in a suite room, so my review is based on this. We have quite mixed feelings about this place. We had a nice time and in many ways the hotel was one of the best we have ever stayed at, but in other ways it was close to the worst.
reviews.title: Good value suites in the shoulder season

reviews.text: When we arrived we found that the hotel was basically closed, there were about 10 guests and about 30 staff. Only one resturant was open and the food selection was very limited. Given how few guests there were this wasn't much of a surprise. At lunch and dinner we always managed to find something we could eat. The deserts were disapointing, and the breakfasts were just aweful. Bread at breakfast was the stale left overs from the previous evening and there wasn't much else to choose from.
reviews.title: wonderful !!!

reviews.text: There was one pool open and the lobby bar was open during the day, but everything else was closed and was being painted. It looked like it would be very nice to eat at the outside resturants and bars once they were open.
reviews.title: My best vacation ever

reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this place in the high season. There are a lot of rooms but the grounds are tiny so would be overcrowded. I would go back there in the shoulder season (perhaps May) and would definitly stay in the suite room again.
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is nice but it quite small and is man made. You can't swim off the beach since it is actually a reef. When we were there the beach was covered in trash the first two days, which made us quite sad. They had 20 staff standing around all doing nothing but no-one would pick up the trash.
reviews.title: Brill

reviews.text: Went back again to the the Tusan second time within a couple of months :) Had a great time with my boys there! Animation team Coco, Chris, Dani Bebo, Joker ,Ozy ,Pickachu,Janna Brilliant lot of people miss them so much Love you all!
reviews.title: Fantastic yet again

reviews.text: They make your holiday better especially if your willing to join in and not moan about things!
reviews.title: what a family

reviews.text: Some of the new reviews that will be put on here are by the people who moaned and winged and theres was quite a few of them so dont believe them they didnt have anything better to do than that!
reviews.title: Nice and well situated

reviews.text: We had a great time shame we had to come home!!
reviews.title: Brilliant holiday

reviews.text: Love you guys Sue Tom Harry xxx
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Money - exceeded expectations
